Class Date

java.lang.Object
Date
public class Date
extends java.lang.Object
A class that stores the date based off an input string. We break down the string and save the year, the month, and the day within the respective instance variables.
Author:
Abimanyu Ananthu, Ashish Shenoy

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Date()
    Creates a Date object that represents today's date with the help of the Java Calender library.

    Creates a Date object based off the given string.

  • Constructor Details

    • Date

      public Date​(java.lang.String date)
      Creates a Date object based off the given string. Using StringTokenizer, it assigns the proper values to the instance variables month, day, and year
      Parameters:
      date - - a string in the form mm/dd/yyyy

    • Date

      public Date()
      Creates a Date object that represents today's date with the help of the Java Calender library. In the event the user doesn't specify a string, this constructor will run

  • Method Details

    • getYear

      public int getYear()
      Returns the year from the date object
      Returns:
      integer value representing the year of the date

    • getMonth

      public int getMonth()
      Returns the month from the date object
      Returns:
      integer value representing the month of the date

    • getDay

      public int getDay()
      Returns the day from the date object
      Returns:
      integer value representing the day of the date

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      Checks if the date is valid and greater than 1900 while taking into account of leap years
      Returns:
      true if the date is valid and greater than year 1900, false otherwise

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string of the date in the format mm/dd/yyyy
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      String representing the date object

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Testbed main to exercise the isValid() method in this class.
      Parameters:
      args - command line arguments
